Class SierpinskiSpinner

  • java.lang.Object
    • SierpinskiSpinner

  • public class SierpinskiSpinner
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Sierpinski triangle fidget spinner, able to draw itself using a provided Graphics object. A Sierpinski spinner is defined by the geometry of a Sierpinski triangle. Two main additions/changes exist however: -Circles are inscribed in the triangles to give the appearance of a fidget spinner. Rectangles (the "arms" of the spinner) are drawn between the circles as well to fill out the appearance. -Each level of triangles spins around the previous level of triangles. This gives the effect of having multiple spinners of decreasing size.
    Version:
    2017-11-15
    Author:
    Stephen, modified by ????

    • Field Detail

      • drawingDepth

        private int drawingDepth
        The recursion depth at which triangles and circles are drawn.

      • baseRadius

        private int baseRadius
        The radius of this spinner.

      • angleOffset

        private double angleOffset
        The initial, absolute offset of the angle this spinner is drawn at.

      • rotationalVelocity

        private double rotationalVelocity
        The rate at which this spinner rotates.

      • toggleCircle

        private boolean toggleCircle
        Whether or not to draw as a fidget spinner. That is, whether or not to draw circles inscribed in the triangles, and wheter or not to draw lines between the circles (the "arms" of a fidget spinner)

      • toggleTriangle

        private boolean toggleTriangle
        Whether or not to draw triangles. These are drawn around where the fidget spinner circles would appear. At angleOffset = 0, this creates a Sierpinski Triangle.

      • filled

        private boolean filled
        Whether or not this spinner should be drawn filled in.

      • center

        private java.awt.Point center
        The center point of the spinner.

      • primaryColorStep

        private java.awt.Color primaryColorStep
        The change in the primary color required at each level of recursion to generate a gradient-like effect in the image.

      • secondaryColorStep

        private java.awt.Color secondaryColorStep
        The change in the secondary color required at each level of recursion to generate a gradient-like effect in the image.

      • BACKGROUND_COLOR

        private static final java.awt.Color BACKGROUND_COLOR
        The background color this spinner is drawn atop of.

      • primaryColor

        private java.awt.Color primaryColor
        The primary color of the spinner. This color is used to draw the triangles.

      • secondaryColor

        private java.awt.Color secondaryColor
        The secondary color of the spinner. This color is used to draw the circles.

      • generateColor

        public java.awt.Color generateColor(boolean isPrimary,
                                    int depth)
        Helper method for the recursive drawing function, produces a color based on the input parameters.
        Parameters:
        isPrimary - If true, generates the appropriate shade of the primary color, otherwise, this generates the appropriate shade of the secondary color.
        depth - The current recursion depth, used to produce the appropriate color.
        Returns:
        The generated color.

      • drawTriangle

        private void drawTriangle(java.awt.Graphics g,
                          java.awt.Point centerPoint,
                          int radius,
                          double rotationOffset,
                          java.awt.Color color,
                          boolean drawFilled)
        Draws a triangle, given the requisite information.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object to use for drawing.
        centerPoint - center
        radius - baseRadius
        rotationOffset - The angle offset at which to draw this triangle.
        color - The color with which to draw this triangle.
        drawFilled - filled

      • drawHelper

        private void drawHelper(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int depth,
                        java.awt.Point centerPoint,
                        int radius,
                        double initialRotationOffset,
                        double rotationOffset)
        Helper function for recursive drawing. This method does the work of recursively computing spinners and drawing them.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to use for drawing.
        depth - drawingDepth
        centerPoint - center
        radius - baseRadius
        initialRotationOffset - The base angle offset at which to draw this spinners. That is, the angle orientation of the base level. This determines the direction the triangles are pointed.
        rotationOffset - The addition angle offset used to compute centerpoints. This increases as the depth decreases to create the effect of the high-depth spinners spinning on top.

      • computeVertex

        public java.awt.Point computeVertex(java.awt.Point centerPoint,
                                    double radius,
                                    double angle)
        Generates a vertex the given distance from the center point, and with the given angle offset.
        Parameters:
        centerPoint - center
        radius - baseRadius
        angle - The angle this vertex is offset from the vertex at the top of the triangle, given that the triangle is resting evenly on one side.
        Returns:
        The generated vertex.

      • ovalFromCenter

        private void ovalFromCenter(java.awt.Graphics g,
                            double centerX,
                            double centerY,
                            double radius)
        Draw a circle given the center point rather than the top-left most point.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to use for drawing.
        centerX - The x position of the center of the circle to draw.
        centerY - The y position of the center of the circle to draw.
        radius - The radius of the circle.
        filled - Whether to draw filled or not.

      • drawThickLine

        private void drawThickLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                           int x1,
                           int y1,
                           int x2,
                           int y2,
                           int thickness)
        Draws a line with a thickness vs. the standard single pixel line. Essentially, just draws a rectangle that is rotated, defined by a thin line through its center - we convert a thin line to a thick line by expanding it on either side to match the thickness.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to use for drawing.
        x1 - The x position of the starting point of the thin line.
        y1 - The y position of the starting point of the thin line.
        x2 - The x position of the ending point of the thin line.
        y2 - The y position of the ending point of the thin line.
        thickness - How many pixels thick the line should be.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws this Sierpinski triangle. A triangle with color BACKGROUND_COLOR should first be drawn before recursively drawing triangles on top of it. Be mindful of both the orientation [see angleOffset] of this initial triangle, and the orientation of the triangles drawn on top of it [should be oriented 180 degrees from initial triangle]. This should only be done if the spinner should display triangles (toggleTriangle = true).
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to use for drawing.
